alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued March 29 at 11:59AM PDT until March 29 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 5 to 7 feet with local sets to 8 feet, along with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Ventura County Coast. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of drowning due to the hazardous conditions. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds in the inner waters will drive enough wave energy to postpone the end of the high surf advisory until 8 pm.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
